Evidence Statements: The student can draw a picture showing the original material, like ice, before it is heated.
The student can draw and label the material after heating, showing the change, like ice melting into water.
The student can illustrate and label how the heating change can be reversed by cooling, such as water freezing back into ice.
The student can include a comparison showing a change that is not reversible, like an egg cooking.
The student can show cause and effect by drawing events that lead to observable changes.
